Overview.Description: Play-test and simulate your game inside Unreal Editor without building it into a standalone application.
Overview.Key_Difference: PIE starts at Player Start location with player control. SIE doesn't move the Camera or spawn a player character.

PIE_Tutorial.Project_Setup: Create a new project using the Blueprint Third Person template with Starter Content enabled.

Steps.Action: Click Play on the Main Toolbar.
Steps.Result: Game starts in the Level Editor Viewport.

Steps.Action: Click or right-click in the Level Editor Viewport.
Steps.Result: Assign mouse control to the playable character.

Steps.Action: Use WASD keys for movement, Spacebar to jump, Mouse for camera.
Pause the game with Shift + F1, click Pause.
Steps.Result: Play button changes to Resume, Frame Skip available.

Steps.Action: Select text in the Level Viewport, change its value.
Steps.Result: Text changes in the Level Viewport.

Steps.Action: Right-click text Actor, select Keep Simulation Changes.

Play_Modes.Access: From Main Toolbar, click vertical ellipsis button.

Steps.Action: Open Starter Content > Props, drag Material Sphere to Level.
Enable Simulate Physics in Details panel.
Steps.Result: Sphere falls to ground on play.

Steps.Action: Press Alt + S (Windows) or Option + S (macOS) to simulate.

Steps.Result: Step through simulation with Frame Advance.

Overview.Description: Running the engine as a game or editor, including launching specific maps and using in-game commands.
Overview.Operating_Systems: Instructions are for Development build configuration.
Overview.Binary_Info: Use UEEditor-_.exe or UE-_.exe for other configurations.

Steps: Run UEEditor.exe with project path as argument: UEEditor.exe '[ProjectPath][ProjectName].uproject'
Create and rename shortcut for UEEditor.exe.
Add project path to Target property and save: '[LauncherInstall][VersionNumber]/Engine/Binaries/Win64/UEEditor.exe '[ProjectPath][ProjectName].uproject'

Running_Editor.No_Arguments: Launches Project Browser to create or open projects.

Steps: Run UEEditor.exe with project path and -game parameter: UEEditor.exe '[ProjectPath][ProjectName].uproject' -game
Create and rename shortcut for UEEditor.exe.
Add project path and -game to Target property and save: '[LauncherInstall][VersionNumber]/Engine/Binaries/Win64/UEEditor.exe '[ProjectPath][ProjectName].uproject' -game'

Running_Unreal_Engine.Running_Cooked_Game: See Packaging Projects for running cooked builds.

In_Game_Commands.Description: Use console commands for various functions.
In_Game_Commands.Access: Summon console with ~ or Tab keys.

Startup.Override_Map: Use command line to specify map: UEEditor.exe '[ProjectPath][ProjectName].uproject' ExampleMap -game
